channel.title: Port Forwarding
channel.description: Hey guys, im on a laptop that connects to my dads cpu's router thats a MI-424-WR for internet. Im trying to portforward and for some reason its saying "login failed" when I enter the correct user and pass. Is port forwarding required for making a server?

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

Xandra:

Thanks so much! I reset it and it worked! TYTYTYTYTYTY!

Your Welcome .

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

If its still not working then that means your dad must have set a particular username and password. Either you can get your dad to tell you the log in, or get his permission to reset the router ( usually there is a reset button in the back, stick in a paper clip and hold it down). Once the router is reset the default log in will be set back to admin/password.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Xandra Xandra
item.description:
@Xandra wrote:

It says that my particular router’s user and pass is admin/password. im entering tht and its still not working ._.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

The 192.168.1.1 is where everyone has to go to set up port forwarding through the router. The user name and password prompt once you type in 192.168.1.1 varies depending on router.

Going to www.portforward.com and selecting your appropriate model router will help you set up port forwarding for that current router.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Xandra Xandra
item.description:
@Xandra wrote:

Im using portforward.com but it still makes you do the 192.168.1.1 thing. And when I enter that into my browser, I use them same user and pass I use to go into verizon.net… and it still wont work.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

http://portforward.com/

Most router logs in are

User:admin
pass:password

And yes port forwarding is required for people to connect to your server. Theres another option such as hamachi where people just need a username and password to connect to your server. I wouldnt advise it though.

Read full topic
